intro: Warneckea cordiformis, commonly known as the heart-shaped warneckea, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are usually glossy and can grow up to 20 centimeters in length. Warneckea cordiformis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
